title: Fixed Assets
content:
A fixed asset is an asset that will be in use for a long term (typically more than a year). You can capitalize (CAPEX) and depreciate itÂ over several years in the general ledger. The decision of whether an asset will be a fixed asset or not is often related to the general ledger, country regulations, and the customer decision.

Fixed Assets enable you to view or refer to financial details of assets, such as acquisition cost, depreciation and residual value, and disposal information. The feature helps you manage your assets from a financial perspective.
